title: Manage dependencies doesn't do anything
body: ### Component Forge ### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date? - [X] Foundry - [X] Foundryup ### What version of Foundry are you on? forge 0.2.0 (85f25c6 2023-11-08T00:39:13.596331000Z) ### What command(s) is the bug in? forge installl / forge remove / forge update ### Operating System macOS (Apple Silicon) ### Describe the bug I want to update my dependencies mainly for getting openzeppelin v5.0.0 here is my `.gitmodule` file: ``` [submodule "lib/forge-std"] path = lib/forge-std url = https://github.com/foundry-rs/forge-std [submodule "lib/openzeppelin-contracts"] path = lib/openzeppelin-contracts url = https://github.com/openzeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts [submodule "lib/solmate"] path = lib/solmate url = https://github.com/transmissions11/solmate [submodule "lib/prb-test"] path = lib/prb-test url = https://github.com/PaulRBerg/prb-test ``` and my folder content : When I do `forge update` or `forge update lib/openzeppelin-contracts` or `forge update openzeppelin-contracts` nothing change even if I add into openzeppelin-contracts submodule `branch = "v5.0.0"` I then tried to remove everything and reinstall them, so I had delete the lib folder and the content of my `.gitmodule` but it doesn't work, forge install return an error: ``` ╰─ forge install openzeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts@v5.0.0 --no-commit Installing openzeppelin-contracts in /Users/xutyr/Dev/MetaDexDAO/Contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts (url: Some("https://github.com/openzeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts"), tag: Some("v5.0.0")) fatal: 'lib/openzeppelin-contracts' already exists in the index and is not a submodule Error: git submodule exited with code 128 ``` Finally I had revert my change and tried to use the `forge remove` and getting also an error ... ``` ╰─ forge remove openzeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts Error: git rm exited with code 128: fatal: not removing 'lib/openzeppelin-contracts' recursively without -r ``` I also checked around git submodule but nothing happened I'm block and have no idea how to reset my submodules config :sad Is there a way to reset all our submodules?

I also tried PRB solution :
https://twitter.com/PaulRBerg/status/1629425771457531905 

no effect at all
